image.altText: Julian Assange looks to the camera as he is photographed from behind glass with graffiti etched into it. His grey hair is back.

props.synopsis: Outside, supporters chanted his name and held placards bearing his face, while inside, lawyers told the overflowing London courtroom of a "truly breathtaking" plot to poison him, but an ill Julian Assange wasn't there to witness any of it.

title.children: Julian Assange too ill to attend as court hears claim of 'breathtaking' plot to poison him

image.altText: A group of protesters outside the City of Melbourne council building

props.synopsis: The council said it received over 900 items of correspondence in response to a motion tabled at Tuesday's meeting, and heard from more than a dozen speakers in person.

title.children: Melbourne city council votes down one Gaza ceasefire motion, passes a second as hundreds gather outside town hall

image.altText: A woman looking at a piece of paper in her backyard

props.synopsis: As the cost-of-living crisis continues to bite, the amount of outstanding road toll fines continues to climb in low-income areas in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Tens of thousands of unpaid road toll fines across Melbourne's south-east, as cost-of-living crisis bites

image.altText: An illustration of a man using two laptops.

props.synopsis: Tony found himself with too much time on his hands at work. What he did next challenges long-held notions of loyalty in the workplace.

title.children: This secretive community found a loophole in how we work

image.altText: A strong storm over Sydney

props.synopsis: Another week of wild weather has been forecast for many parts of Australia, after different parts of the nation endured scorching heat, flash-flooding, and cyclones

title.children: Another wild week of weather is in store for Australia, with potentially damaging consequences

image.altText: A live sports betting site on a mobile phone, April 24, 2020.

props.synopsis: Younger people have been fastest to sign on to the national gambling exclusion register BetStop, which requires online gambling services to check in with the register before processing requests.

title.children: 18,000 Australians sign onto BetStop in first six months, with majority of early adopters under 40

image.altText: Fresh produce stacked in a cold fridge.

props.synopsis: With details emerging of the tactics employed by Coles and Woolworths to increase profits at the check-out, what are the multiple inquiries on supermarket pricing examining, and what might they accomplish?

title.children: What are the six inquiries into Australia's surging grocery prices looking at?

image.altText: A woman at a rally during the Indonesian election campaign

props.synopsis: Recent election campaigns from Pakistan, India and Indonesia have shown radical new uses of generative AI that change how campaigns are run. Here's what's coming for Australia and the rest of the world.

title.children: From deepfake speeches to endorsements from the dead, AI is shaping elections around the world

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits beside water while a woman in a blue shirt puts her arms around his neck.

props.synopsis: The family of imprisoned Australian Yang Hengjun reveal he will not appeal his suspended death sentence in China, saying the writer has no faith in the Chinese court system, and that his ill health makes it impossible for him to continue his legal fight.

title.children: 'Innocent and morally unbreakable': Family of Australian man say he will not appeal suspended death sentence

image.altText: Football playre Joel Smith walks on the field. He has a neutral expression

props.synopsis: The AFL says Melbourne Demons player Joel Smith has been hit with anti-doping breaches for the trafficking and possession of cocaine.

title.children: Melbourne Demons AFL player Joel Smith accused of trafficking cocaine

image.altText: A man holds a tyre in a tyre shop.

props.synopsis: Victorian motorists are urging governments to speed up road repairs after waiting more than a year for fixes to large potholes and other flood damage on major highways.

title.children: Victorian tyre shops overrun as damage from potholes and flood-damaged bitumen 'explodes'

image.altText: The snow-covered entrance to a Russian prison camp, showing road barriers and guard towers.

props.synopsis: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny spent his final weeks in the "Polar Wolf" penal colony. From the remote location north of the Arctic Circle, he was able to share stories of the conditions he faced in one of Russia's harshest prisons.

title.children: Alexei Navalny died in one of Russia's harshest prisons. Here's what he faced at the 'Polar Wolf'

image.altText: A large military ship with balancing skis glides through the water.

props.synopsis: Six large and "optionally crewed" naval vessels heavily armed with missiles will be added to Australia's surface fleet under a dramatic $11 billion reshaping of the navy that will also see the acquisition of 11 new general-purpose frigates to be partly built overseas.

title.children: Heavily armed 'optionally crewed' ships to enter service under reshaping of Australia's naval fleet

image.altText: police tape and emergency vehicles

props.synopsis: The body of a man was located in Baulkham Hills, while two other bodies, a woman and a child, were found inside a martial arts studio in North Parramatta.

title.children: 'It's pretty frightening': Three bodies found in two Sydney locations as police treat them as linked

image.altText: large yellow bags laid out on the tarmac in front of a light plane

props.synopsis: The 41-year-old businesswoman was arrested at her multi-million-dollar acreage home in Brisbane's south last month and charged in connection with an attempt to traffic drugs from Papua New Guinea into Queensland.

title.children: Why the AFP is alleging a mum-of-four is a key figure in a 'transnational crime syndicate'

image.altText: Former Tasmanian premier Lara Giddings speaks with a graphic of two hands shaking behind her.

props.synopsis: Ten years ago, Tasmania was ruled by a minority government. With an election on for March 23, and a solid chance of a repeat, this former leader and others say it will be "good for democracy".

title.children: Tasmanians are being warned about minority government, but this former leader says it will be 'good for democracy'

image.altText: Prince William wears a suit and sits in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Prince William says he is deeply concerned about the "human cost" of the Israel-Gaza war in an unusual political move from a royal family member.

title.children: Prince William says 'too many' have been killed in Gaza conflict

image.altText: Mushrooms lay on a white surface.

props.synopsis: In 2023 Australia's TGA made the decision to take some psychedelic drugs off the prohibited list but the medical fraternity is split over the expectation of what they can do for people versus the reality of prescribing them.

title.children: Psychedelics can be used to treat mental health conditions but one doctor's social media moment has caused concern

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair wearing a black and red patterned blazer mid-sentence on a stage pointing her finger.

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia boss Jayne Hrdlicka announces she will step down after almost four years at the helm of the airline.

title.children: 'The time is right': Jayne Hrdlicka steps down as Virgin Australia CEO after almost four years

image.altText: Associate Professor Shaun Gregory hands holding his artificial heart device

props.synopsis: Australian scientists are developing a long-term artificial heart, with the federal government announcing a grant of $50 million towards the revolutionary project.

title.children: Australian researchers' world-leading artificial heart began with a trip to the hardware store

image.altText: Upwards shot of the BHP building in Perth.

props.synopsis: A year after BHP singled out nickel as a key growth area for its business, the metal's price has plummeted. As it weighs up closing its nickel operations, BHP's boss says it's unlikely the metal will be profitable before the end of the decade.

title.children: BHP boss says nickel business has been making a loss for years as Nickel West hangs in the balance

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: Queensland's voluntary assisted dying (VAD) process is being probed by a coroner after an elderly man took an oral substance, which was prescribed for his terminally ill wife.

title.children: Inquest into Queensland's voluntary assisted dying laws begins after man takes wife's end-of-life medication

image.altText: Three ships line up in open waters with refueling lines connecting them.

props.synopsis: Don't know your frigates from your AWDs and OPVs? Here's a run down of how Australia's surface naval fleet looks, and how it will change under the federal government's new plan.

title.children: How will Australia's surface naval fleet change under the reshaped Navy?

image.altText: A black and white photo of a footballer completing his follow-through after blasting the ball towards goal.

props.synopsis: Andreas "Andi" Brehme, the man who scored the goal that won the 1990 World Cup final for West Germany, dies suddenly at 63.

title.children: German World Cup winning footballer Andreas Brehme dies at 63

image.altText: Morwell police station

props.synopsis: Coroner hears David James Dorling complained to custody officers at Dandenong Police Station he had chest pain and said he had taken a large amount of medication.

title.children: Inquest begins into man's death in custody after pleading guilty to child sex abuse offences

image.altText: Lightning in brissy

props.synopsis: As four people remain in hospital after being struck by lightning in Sydney on Monday, experts reveal how to stay safe if you're caught in a storm.

title.children: A lighting strike can stop your heart and cause long term brain damage. Here's how to stay safe when a storm comes

image.altText: a close up of carroll

props.synopsis: Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll became the first woman to head the Queensland Police Service in 2019 after rising to prominence as the operations commander for Australia's largest peacetime security operation.

title.children: There were many 'dark days' for Queensland's first female police commissioner, but she says leaving was her decision

image.altText: Mulch particles being examined under a microscope.

props.synopsis: WorkSafe ACT confirms mulch contaminated by bonded asbestos has been supplied to customers in the territory, and warns anyone who purchased '"cottage mulch" products between March 1, 2023 and February 19, 2024 not to distribute or disturb it.

title.children: 'Do not move potentially contaminated material': Asbestos-contaminated mulch distributed to 12 businesses in ACT

image.altText: Path leading to Tree area and mulch fenced off at Bicentennial Park 1, Glebe

props.synopsis: Bicentennial Park, an aged care facility, a parish and a private residence are among new sites that have tested positive for asbestos in Sydney.

title.children: Dangerous asbestos detected at popular Sydney park as more contaminated sites revealed

image.altText: A mural painted in graffiti style on a wall.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous teenager died in 2022 after an unmarked police car collided with a motorbike he was riding in Sydney.

title.children: NSW Police officer charged over collision that resulted in death of Indigenous teenager

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a serious expression.

props.synopsis: It is unclear why social network X, formerly Twitter, briefly suspended the account of Yulia Navalnaya, the widow of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny.

title.children: Social media platform X briefly suspends account of Alexei Navalny's widow Yulia Navalnaya

image.altText: Side-profile mid-close-up of a white man in a light blue collared shirt, walking past a big news camera.

props.synopsis: The widow of Netflix star Chris "Willow" Wilson is seeking to freeze Matt Wright's assets as the Federal Court considers her bid to personally add the celebrity crocodile wrangler to a civil lawsuit over her husband's death.

title.children: Chopper crash widow seeks to freeze celebrity crocodile wrangler's assets

image.altText: Man with dark hair, wearing dark grey t-shirt, looks at the camera in a close-up photo.

props.synopsis: An inquest into the death of Jarrad Antonovich at a spiritual retreat in 2021 has been adjourned after a number of fresh witnesses contacted police.

title.children: New witnesses come forward during inquest into man's death after frog poison ceremony

image.altText: An American Staffordshire Terrier sits in a grass field

props.synopsis: A council ranger has told an inquest into fatal attacks that the dog breed that mauled a newborn to death in 2021 was commonly involved in attacks across New South Wales' Central Coast.

title.children: Inquest hears American Staffordshire terriers are the breed 'most' responsible for dog attacks on Central Coast

image.altText: GAP greyhound waiting for adoption

props.synopsis: Coalition for the Protection of Greyhounds research finds many greyhounds are euthanased away from the track after being seriously injured while racing.

title.children: Greyhound protection group calls for federal inquiry into racing after off-track deaths
